text: The women's 200 metres sprint competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 9 and 11 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Chandra Cheeseborough of the United States. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |21.71 |Karl-Marx-Stadt, East Germany |June 10, 1979 |- |Pan American Games record | |22.77 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All times shown are in seconds. Evelyn Ashford's mark in the final was not considered a new Pan American record because of favorable wind of 2.12 m/s. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Heats=== Held on 9 July Wind: Heat 1: +4.7 m/s, Heat 2: +2.8 m/s, Heat 3: +2.3 m/s {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !!
